title: Split DeviceManager responsibilities
description:
Refactor DeviceManager (very large) into smaller units:
- BLE scan orchestration
- Group management + membership inference
- Mesh action execution + status window tracking
- Device repository/state updates

Acceptance:
- Clear module boundaries.
- UI depends on a stable facade.
- Minimal behavior changes; tests still pass.

title: Align Dart/native callback events
description:
Fix dead-by-mismatch: Dart listens for events the native plugin never emits.

Current mismatch (examples):
- Dart handles onMeshPduCreated / onCharacteristicNotification / onBatteryLevel / onSubscriptionReady.
- Android MeshPlugin currently only invokes onDeviceStatus (and never invokes the above).

Options:
A) Implement the missing callbacks in Android (invokeMethod with payload schema).
B) Remove the Dart handlers + dependent code paths.
C) Gate via capabilities (isAvailable + supportedEvents list).

Acceptance:
- No unused callback handlers remain.
- DeviceManager/DeviceDetailsScreen flows match reality.

title: Fix use_rethrow_when_possible finding
description:
Fix use_rethrow_when_possible in lib/managers/gatt_mesh_client.dart by using `rethrow` where appropriate.

Acceptance:
- No use_rethrow_when_possible findings remain.
- No behavior changes in error handling semantics.
- flutter test passes.

title: Resolve stubbed native MethodChannel methods
description:
Fix dead-by-mismatch: Dart calls native methods that are currently stubbed on Android.

Android stubs today include:
- getLightStates, getBatteryLevels, subscribeToCharacteristics
- isDeviceConnected, disconnectDevice
- discoverServices, readCharacteristic, writeCharacteristic, setNotify

Acceptance:
- Either implement these properly in MeshPlugin OR remove/disable the Dart callers.
- UI does not expose non-functional actions.

title: Fix brace-style lint findings
description:
Address curly_braces_in_flow_control_structures findings (mostly in lib/managers/device_manager.dart).

Scope:
- Add braces to single-statement if/for/while where required.
- Avoid behavior changes.

Acceptance:
- No curly_braces_in_flow_control_structures findings remain.
- flutter test passes.

title: Document analysis_options.yaml conventions
description:
Add a short doc note explaining:
- Why glob patterns are quoted (YAML alias rules).
- What we exclude and why (generated, build, native folders).
- Whether analyzer issues fail CI and how to run locally.

Acceptance:
- Documentation exists (README/TECHNICAL/SETUP).
- New contributors can run flutter analyze without surprises.

title: Choose lint/analyzer policy
description:
Decide repo policy for analyzer/lints so developers + CI get consistent behavior.

Options:
A) Fix code to satisfy flutter_lints (preferred long-term).
B) Keep code as-is but configure analysis_options.yaml severity overrides (e.g., ignore or downgrade some lints).
C) Mixed: enforce critical lints, relax style-only lints.

Acceptance:
- Documented decision in README/TECHNICAL.
- analysis_options.yaml matches the decision.
- flutter analyze behavior is predictable in CI.

title: Simplify DeviceDetailsScreen connection paths
description:
DeviceDetailsScreen currently tries FlutterBlue scanning/connecting and also plugin-managed flows.

Goal:
- Make one clear path for mobile (native mesh plugin) and one for desktop/mock.
- Remove or hide flows that rely on stubbed native methods.

Acceptance:
- Screen behavior is deterministic.
- No calls into stubbed plugin APIs.
- No scanning/connect churn that fights DeviceManager scan cycles.

title: Update docs after removing sdks/
description:
We removed the vendored sdks/ directory.

Goal:
- Update docs to reflect that Android uses the Maven dependency for no.nordicsemi.android:mesh.
- Remove any references that assume local SDK sources exist.

Acceptance:
- README/SETUP/TECHNICAL mention correct dependency approach.
- No stale references to sdks/ remain.

title: Define MethodChannel API contract
description:
Define the authoritative platform API between Dart PlatformMeshClient and native MeshPlugin.

Deliverable:
- A single source of truth doc or code-level spec: supported methods, args, return types, callback events.

Acceptance:
- Dart side and Android side implement the same contract.
- Unsupported features are removed or gated behind capability checks.

title: Add mesh-client capability tests
description:
Add targeted tests for MeshClient/PlatformMeshClient capability gating:
- When plugin unavailable, fallback path used.
- No UI attempts to call unsupported native methods.

Acceptance:
- Tests cover plugin-available vs plugin-unavailable paths.
- Prevents regressions in the platform contract.

title: Fix prefer_is_not_operator finding
description:
Fix the prefer_is_not_operator analyzer finding in lib/managers/device_manager.dart (use `is!` instead of `!(x is T)`).

Acceptance:
- No prefer_is_not_operator findings remain.
- flutter test passes.

title: Externalize mesh credentials
description:
DeviceManager currently hardcodes mesh netKey/appKey.

Goal:
- Move credentials to a secure configuration mechanism suitable for dev testing (and later production).
- Avoid committing secrets.

Acceptance:
- Credentials loaded from config (e.g., environment, secure storage, local file excluded by gitignore).
- Clear developer docs for mesh testing.

title: Centralize MAC normalization
description:
MAC normalization is repeated across Dart and Kotlin (upper/lower, dash/colon).

Goal:
- Single utility in Dart (and Kotlin if needed) used everywhere.
- Avoid subtle mismatches in lookups, caches, and listener maps.

Acceptance:
- One canonical normalization function.
- Updated callers.
- No behavior regressions.
